      âœ• should initialize worker with correct configuration
      âœ• should initialize retry configuration
      âœ• should have Stripe initialized when billing enabled
      âœ• should not have Stripe when billing disabled

      âœ• should route subscription_cancelled jobs to correct handler

      âœ• should throw error for unknown job types

      âœ• should cap delay at maximum value (1 ms)
      âœ• should return base delay when exponential backoff disabled

      âœ• should handle queue service errors

      âœ• should process retry job by calling original job type handler

      âœ• should classify as roastable even with slight recidivism adjustment

      âœ• should publish normal even for repeat offender with very low toxicity

      âœ“ should check limit and increment usage in sequence

  AuditLogService
    constructor
      âœ“ should initialize with correct event types
      âœ“ should set correct log file path
    logEvent
      âœ“ should log valid event to database when Supabase is enabled
      âœ• should fallback to file logging when database fails (1 ms)
      âœ“ should use file logging when Supabase is disabled (1 ms)
      âœ“ should reject unknown event types
      âœ“ should handle complete logging failure gracefully
      âœ“ should include environment and timestamp in details
    saveToDatabaseAuditLog
      âœ“ should save audit entry to database successfully (1 ms)
      âœ“ should throw error when database operation fails (2 ms)
    saveToFileAuditLog
      âœ“ should create directory and append to file
      âœ“ should propagate file system errors (1 ms)
    getRecentLogs
      âœ“ should retrieve logs from database when Supabase is enabled
      âœ• should apply filters correctly
      âœ“ should retrieve logs from file when Supabase is disabled (1 ms)
      âœ“ should handle missing file gracefully
      âœ“ should handle malformed JSON in log file
      âœ“ should handle database errors gracefully
    helper methods
      âœ“ logUserLogin should log auth.login event correctly (1 ms)
      âœ“ logBillingEvent should log billing events with correct prefix
      âœ“ logIntegrationEvent should log integration events correctly (1 ms)
      âœ“ logSystemEvent should log system events correctly
    getEventStats
      âœ“ should return statistics for specified time range
      âœ“ should return error when Supabase is disabled
      âœ“ should handle database errors in stats (1 ms)
    getStartDateForRange
      âœ• should calculate correct start dates for different ranges
    cleanOldLogs
      âœ“ should clean old logs when Supabase is enabled
      âœ“ should return false when Supabase is disabled
      âœ• should handle cleanup errors gracefully
    singleton instance
      âœ“ should export singleton auditLogger instance

    processTierChange
      Upgrades
        âœ“ should process upgrade immediately (1 ms)
        âœ“ should handle upgrade error gracefully (5 ms)
      Downgrades
        âœ“ should schedule downgrade for next billing cycle (1 ms)
        âœ“ should insert pending change record
      No Change
        âœ“ should handle same tier request
    cancelPendingDowngrade
      âœ“ should cancel pending downgrade successfully
      âœ“ should handle no pending changes (1 ms)
    validateTierChangeEligibility
      âœ• should validate eligible upgrade
      âœ• should block change when pending changes exist
      Downgrade Eligibility
        âœ• should allow downgrade when usage is within new limits (1 ms)
        âœ• should block downgrade when usage exceeds new limits
    processDuePlanChanges
      âœ“ should process due plan changes successfully
      âœ“ should handle processing errors
    Plan Hierarchy
      âœ“ should identify free to starter as upgrade (1 ms)
      âœ“ should identify free to pro as upgrade (11 ms)
      âœ“ should identify free to plus as upgrade
      âœ“ should identify starter to pro as upgrade
      âœ“ should identify starter to plus as upgrade
      âœ“ should identify pro to plus as upgrade
      âœ“ should identify plus to pro as downgrade
      âœ“ should identify pro to starter as downgrade
      âœ“ should identify pro to free as downgrade
      âœ“ should identify starter to free as downgrade
      âœ“ should identify free to free as no_change (1 ms)
      âœ“ should identify pro to pro as no_change
    Edge Cases
      âœ• should handle user with no subscription (defaults to free)
      âœ“ should handle invalid tier gracefully (1 ms)

  CircuitBreaker
    CLOSED state
      âœ“ should execute operation successfully when closed (1 ms)
      âœ“ should remain closed after single failure (6 ms)
      âœ“ should open after reaching failure threshold (1 ms)
    OPEN state
      âœ“ should reject requests immediately when open (2 ms)
      âœ“ should use fallback when open (1 ms)
      âœ“ should transition to HALF_OPEN after recovery timeout (1101 ms)
    HALF_OPEN state
      âœ“ should close on successful operation (1102 ms)
      âœ“ should open immediately on failure (1101 ms)
    Expected errors
      âœ“ should not count expected errors as failures (1 ms)
      âœ“ should handle function-based expected error detection
    Metrics
      âœ“ should provide accurate metrics
    Force state
      âœ“ should allow forcing circuit breaker state (1 ms)

    Out of the box Jest supports Babel, which will be used to transform your files into valid JS based on your Babel configuration.

    By default "node_modules" folder is ignored by transformers.

    Here's what you can do:
     â€¢ If you are trying to use ECMAScript Modules, see https://jestjs.io/docs/ecmascript-modules for how to enable it.
     â€¢ If you are trying to use TypeScript, see https://jestjs.io/docs/getting-started#using-typescript
     â€¢ To have some of your "node_modules" files transformed, you can specify a custom "transformIgnorePatterns" in your config.
     â€¢ If you need a custom transformation, specify a "transform" option in your config.
     â€¢ If you simply want to mock your non-JS modules (e.g. binary assets) you can stub them out with the "moduleNameMapper" config option.

    You'll find more details and examples of these config options in the docs:
    https://jestjs.io/docs/configuration
    For information about custom transformations, see:
    https://jestjs.io/docs/code-transformation

     â€¢ If you are trying to use ECMAScript Modules, see https://jestjs.io/docs/ecmascript-modules for how to enable it.

     â€¢ If you need a custom transformation, specify a "transform" option in your config.

    Jest encountered an unexpected token

    Jest failed to parse a file. This happens e.g. when your code or its dependencies use non-standard JavaScript syntax, or when Jest is not configured to support such syntax.

    Out of the box Jest supports Babel, which will be used to transform your files into valid JS based on your Babel configuration.

    By default "node_modules" folder is ignored by transformers.

    Here's what you can do:
     â€¢ If you are trying to use ECMAScript Modules, see https://jestjs.io/docs/ecmascript-modules for how to enable it.
     â€¢ If you are trying to use TypeScript, see https://jestjs.io/docs/getting-started#using-typescript
     â€¢ To have some of your "node_modules" files transformed, you can specify a custom "transformIgnorePatterns" in your config.
     â€¢ If you need a custom transformation, specify a "transform" option in your config.
     â€¢ If you simply want to mock your non-JS modules (e.g. binary assets) you can stub them out with the "moduleNameMapper" config option.

    You'll find more details and examples of these config options in the docs:
    https://jestjs.io/docs/configuration
    For information about custom transformations, see:
    https://jestjs.io/docs/code-transformation
